Dear Mrs. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation This past weekend, youth performed oral sex on another youth
behind a shed on the facility premises.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/24/2023. Youth A reported he was outside with Youth B. Staff 1
was the staff working and was inside the house. Youth A was
sitting at the fire pit talking with Youth B. Youth B asked Youth A
to go behind the shed. Youth A told Youth B “no”. Youth B
grabbed a stick and told Youth A he would stab him with the stick
if he did not go behind the shed. Youth A got up and ran towards
the woods to get away from Youth B. Youth B grabbed Youth A
and pulled him behind the shed. Youth A reported Youth B forced
him down towards his penis and put a stick to his throat. Youth A
reported Staff 1 came out of the house and called for Youth B to
come take his medication. Youth A came out from behind the
shed first and then Youth B. Staff 1 talked to Youth A once back
in the house and asked what happened behind the shed. Youth A
reported one youth is allowed to be outside without a staff
however if there are two youth outside then staff are outside
supervising. Youth A reported it was an accident that he and
Youth B were outside alone without a staff. Youth A reported staff
are typically outside with youth. Youth A reported since then, staff
are with youth at all times. Youth A reported this was the first time
anything like this has happened. Youth A reported he was behind
the shed with Youth B for about thirty seconds.
Youth B was attempted to be interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 4/24/2023. Youth B came to meet with consultant
and refused to participate in an interview.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/24/2023. Staff 1 reported he was outside with Youth A and
Youth B. Staff 1 went inside the house to get medications to pass.
Staff 1 reported he was watching Youth A and Youth B through
the window. Staff 1 looked down to pop the medications from the
package and when he looked up to see Youth A and Youth B
through the window, they were gone. Staff 1 went outside and
called Youth B. Youth A came out from behind the shed. Staff 1
2

called for Youth B and there was no response. Youth A then
called for Youth B and Youth B came out from behind the shed.
Staff 1 noticed both Youth A and Youth B had erections. Staff 1
gave Youth B his medications. Staff 1 reported Youth A and
Youth B were “acting odd”. Staff 1 took Youth A and Youth B into
the house and talked to them. Youth A and Youth B said they
were talking behind the shed. Staff 1 then talked to Youth A
alone. Youth A began crying and reported Youth B forced him to
do sexual acts behind the shed. Staff 1 reported he was in the
house getting medication for approximately three minutes. Staff 1
reported there were no prior concerns with Youth A and Youth B.
Staff 1 reported knowledge of Youth B having sexual abuse
trauma in his past however did not know about Youth A. Staff 1
reported two youth can be outside alone if a staff is watching them
from a window of the house. Staff 1 reported this was the first time
Youth A and Youth B were outside together. Staff 1 reported
since this incident, there are safety plans in place and no youth in
the house are to be out of staff’s direct supervision during waking
hours. Youth A reported other concerns about two other youth to
Staff 1 (this is being addressed in SI 2023C0000396 and
2023C0000410 as well as completed SI 2023C0128002).
Counselor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/24/2023. Counselor reported she was concerned with the
supervision regarding the incident. Counselor reported the
supervision policy states two youth are not to be left alone at any
time without staff supervision. Staff should be outside with youth.
Youth A and Youth B have displayed escalated behaviors since
the incident. There are safety plans now in place. Youth A and
Youth B have history of being victims of sexual abuse.
Case Manager was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/24/2023. Case Manager reported Youth A and Youth B were
momentarily out of Staff 1’s direct line of sight. Once Staff 1
noticed Youth A and Youth B were gone, he went outside to look
for them. Case Manager reported youth are to be in line of sight
of staff at all times. Two youth are never to be alone. If more than
one youth are outside, then staff are to be outside. Case Manager
did not have any prior concerns for Youth A and Youth B.
Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/24/2023. Administrator reported she did not have any concerns
with how Staff 1 provided supervision. Staff are trained if youth
are outside, staff can supervise by watching out the window.
Administrator reported all youth have been placed on safety plans
in the house resulting in staff needing to provide direct supervision
3

as youth are no longer able to be alone and staff need to be able
to hear all conversations between youth. Consultant reviewed the
supervision policy with Administrator. Administrator was not
aware that the policy had not been updated to reflect staff being
able to supervise through the window.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 4/21/2023.
Complainant reported all the youth in the home have been put on
safety plans. Complainant did not have any further concerns or
information.
Documents Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Supervision of Residents Policy: At no time is
more than one youth permitted to be outside of a
home/building without a staff member being physically
present outside with them and having eyes on 100% of the
time. Whenever there is a youth outside by themselves,
staff must keep that youth in their eyesight at all times.
This can be accomplished by looking through a window,
without multitasking that has the potential to distract staff
from maintaining 100% eyes on.
• Eagle Village Incident Report dated 4/15/2023 for Youth B:
Youth B was sitting with another youth by the fire pit
outside. Staff 1 could see the two youth from the
medication cart window. When Staff 1 locked up from
getting medications, the two youth were gone. Staff 1
immediately ran outside and yelled for the two youth to take
their medications. Youth B came from the back of the shed
and proceeded to act in a strange manner. Staff 1 then
called Youth A and he came from behind the shed.
• Eagle Village Incident Report dated 4/15/2023 for Youth A:
Incident report was consistent with Youth B’s incident
report. Youth A’s incident report additionally had the
following information: Staff 1 spoke with Youth A as Youth
A appeared upset. Youth A reported Youth B told him if he
did not go behind the shed, he would hit him with a stick.
Youth B told Youth A if he did not give him oral sex, he
would stab him. Youth B made Youth A give him oral sex.
• Eagle Village Safety Plans for Youth A and Youth B dated
4/15/2023: Youth A is to be closely and always monitored
by staff. Youth A is to be the only youth in the bathroom
when he showers or needs to use the bathroom, is not
allowed in any other youth’s bedrooms and no youth in his
bedroom, not to be alone with any youth, conversations
4

with other youth monitored by staff at all times, and should
be seated next to a staff or in direct eye contact of a staff
during transportation in a vehicle.
• Written recap of Youth A’s statement obtained by Eagle
Village was consistent with Youth A’s interview.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 does not have any discipline
in his personnel file. Staff 1 received training on Eagle
Village policy and procedures on 6/7/2022 and 6/8/2022.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as the facilities internal
supervision policy was not followed. Staff 1 went into the house to
get medication dispensed leaving Youth A and Youth B outside
alone. Staff 1 was watching Youth A and Youth B through the
window and when he looked down to dispense the medications
and looked back up, Youth A and Youth B were gone. Facility
policy states at no time is more than one youth permitted to be
outside of a home/building without a staff member being physically
present outside with them and having eyes on 100% of the time.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2023C0000017 dated 12/2/2022, CAP Approved 12/13/2022.
SIR2023C000019 dated 2/23/2023, CAP Approved 2/23/2023.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
